items.sentence: Tom doesn\'t think that Mary\'s performance was very good.
Tom asked me to buy a dozen eggs on my way home from work.
Tom ate the chocolate chip cookies that Mary made for him.
Tom became friends with Mary when he was living in Boston.
Tom bought a new car with the money he won in the lottery.
Tom brought his car to the repair shop to have it checked.
There was a banner on the wall that said "Happy Birthday."
They announced the date of their wedding in the newspaper.
I think it\'s dangerous for children to swim in this lake.
I\'ve heard that Boston is a very expensive place to live.
Tom is not only unhappy at work, but also unhappy at home.
Tom knew who Mary said she was planning to get married to.
Tom probably bought it with the money his father gave him.
Tom put the popcorn into the pan and waited for it to pop.
Tom didn\'t know Mary wasn\'t going to be able to do that.
Tom didn\'t know how to accept Mary\'s love and affection.
Tom didn\'t know the reason why Mary couldn\'t go bowling.
Mary was annoyed with Tom, and wouldn\'t return his calls.
Mary\'s smiling face let everyone know that she was happy.
Tom\'s yacht is one of the largest yachts I\'ve ever seen.
